metadata.title: CVE-2020-16128 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The aptdaemon DBus interface disclosed file existence disclosure by settingTerminal/DebconfSocket properties, aka GHSL-2020-192 and GHSL-2020-196.This affected versions prior to 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu34.1,1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu32.3, 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu19.5,1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu14.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16128` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

aptdaemon - 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu14.5
aptdaemon-data - 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu14.5
python-aptdaemon - 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu14.5
python-aptdaemon.gtk3widgets - 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu14.5
python3-aptdaemon - 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu14.5
python3-aptdaemon.gtk3widgets - 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu14.5
python3-aptdaemon.pkcompat - 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu14.5
python3-aptdaemon.test - 1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu14.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: aptdaemon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.1+bzr982-0ubuntu14.5').
